definitions.text: the yield from plants in a single growing season
a cultivated plant that is grown commercially on a large scale
a collection of people or things appearing together
examples: the annual crop of students brings a new crop of ideas

definitions.text: the output of something in a season
examples: the latest crop of fashions is about to hit the stores

definitions.text: the stock or handle of a whip
a pouch in many birds and some lower animals that resembles a stomach for storage and preliminary maceration of food

examples: She wanted her hair cropped short

definitions.text: let feed in a field or pasture or meadow
feed as in a meadow or pasture
cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of
examples: dress the plants in the garden
